channel.title: Google Search on Shantanu Vs The World
channel.description: Recent content in Google Search on Shantanu Vs The World

item.title: Use Encrypted Google Search As Default in Chrome
item.author: shantanu@shantanugoel.com (Shantanu Goel)
item.description: Google just launched an encrypted search portal which is a Godsend for people on public networks since there is a lot that can be gleaned from your search queries. For doing your protected searches, however, you have to go to a different portal which I linked to above. Now, the omnibar (the address bar in Google Chrome) also serves as a search box but searches on the normal google portal by default.

item.title: ZDNet Fail. Answer is Stop Tech Blogging
item.author: shantanu@shantanugoel.com (Shantanu Goel)
item.description: Just read this article over at zdnet. What it basically says is condensed in these two points: Android is a failure for Google because it is open and carriers/OEMs are stripping off google search from it and putting replacements like baidu/Bing. (BTW, half the people say Android is fail because it is not open and the other half say it is fail because it is open. Which one is it, please decide ;) )

item.title: One Month Completed....
item.author: shantanu@shantanugoel.com (Shantanu Goel)
item.description: Today, this blog completes one month of its existence in this world. The achievements, although minuscule in comparison to all the biggies out there, are significant for me. It achieved the following things in just 30 days from the first post: Front-paged at LifeHacker, HacksZine, and many others. Over 10000 (Ten Thousand) “unique” human visitors. Over 30000 (Thirty Thousand) page views by humans. Over 500000 (Half Million) total hits for all website files included.
